name: ENCELTO

indications.text: encelto indicated treatment adults idiopathic macular telangiectasia type 2 ( mactel ) .

contraindications.text: intravitreal implantation . encelto intended surgical intravitreal implantation aseptic conditions qualified ophthalmologist . ( 2.1 ) recommended dose one encelto implant per affected eye containing 200,000 440,000 allogeneic retinal pigment epithelial cells expressing recombinant human ciliary neurotrophic factor ( rhcntf ) . ( 2.1 ) carefully inspect encelto prior refer instructions preparing performing surgical placement removal encelto . ( 2.2 , 2.3 )

adverseReactions: encelto contraindicated patients : active suspected ocular periocular infections . known hypersensitivity endothelial serum free media ( endo-sfm )
indications_original: ENCELTO is indicated for the treatment of adults with idiopathic macular telangiectasia type 2 (MacTel).
contraindications_original: For intravitreal implantation only. ENCELTO is intended for surgical intravitreal implantation under aseptic conditions by a qualified ophthalmologist. ( 2.1 ) The recommended dose is one ENCELTO implant per affected eye containing 200,000 to 440,000 allogeneic retinal pigment epithelial cells expressing recombinant human ciliary neurotrophic factor (rhCNTF). ( 2.1 ) Carefully inspect ENCELTO prior to use and refer to the Instructions for Use when preparing for and performing surgical placement or removal of ENCELTO. ( 2.2 , 2.3 )
adverseReactions_original:
ENCELTO is contraindicated in patients with: 
                  
                  
                     Active or suspected ocular or periocular infections.  
                     Known hypersensitivity to Endothelial Serum Free Media (Endo-SFM)
